FuncDef: The reset aaa statistics command clears the statistics on authentication or accounting packets.
CLIs: reset aaa statistics { authentication | accounting } [ domain <domain-name> ]

ParaDef.Info:
Clears the statistics on authentication packets.
-

Clears the statistics on accounting packets.
-

Clears the statistics on authentication or accounting packets in a specified domain. domain-name specifies the name of a domain.
The asterisk (*), question mark (?), or quotation marks ("") cannot be used in a domain name. The value is a string of 1 to 64 case-insensitive characters.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Before collecting the statistics on authentication or accounting packets in a specified length of time, run the reset aaa statistics command to clear the original statistics. Then, running the display aaa statistics command will display correct statistics.
Running the reset aaa statistics command can clear all the statistics on authentication or accounting packets, or the statistics on authentication or accounting packets in a specified domain. The statistics include those on authentication or accounting request packets, authentication or accounting success response packets, and authentication or accounting failure response packets.
After the reset aaa statistics command is run to clear the statistics on authentication or accounting packets, the cleared statistics cannot be restored.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
